297R/A0/08/003/013.status_value: End of Cycle/End-Year: The capacity building intiatives undertaken by the ROSA nutrition section in 2012-2013  included (i) anthropometric training for MICS team (Bangladesh  2012)  (ii) MoRES (Nepal and Bangladesh  2012)  (iii) Emergency Nutrition training (Pakistan  2013)  (iv) capacity needs assessment for nutrition in the EU-funded Maternal and Young Child Nutrition Security Initiative in Asia (MYCNSIA) project countries (2012-2013) and (v) supportive supervision training to strengthen IYCF

297R/A0/08/003/013.status_value: End of Cycle/End-Year: In 2012-2013  partnerships enhanced with two organisations: European Union and SAARC . Under the partnership with SAARC  the Framework for Nutrition was presented and approved at the Technical Committee meeting for Health and Population and will be formally endorsed at the Health Ministers Conference scheduled for 2014. With the European Union  regular programme updates are shared with EAPRO and HQ.
297R/A0/08/003/013.baseline_value: Co-shared the forum on Nutrition with WB. Participation in two Steering committee with EU.

297R/A0/08/003/013.status_value: Out of 20 CO requests on nutrition requiring 40 activities  13 technical responses were fulfilled. However  an additional 23 actions were convergent and involved nutrition and other YCSD sectors.  Through mission or online support  42.5% YCSD Nutrition ROSA support focused on technical support  20% each on capacity building and knowledge management and 17.5% on Partnerships carried out.   30 days were spent on timely missions to countries.

Develop regional framework on nurition with SAARC

297R/A0/08/003/012.status_value: 2013:  Positive interviews highlighting UNICEF's role in the region were produced around the HLM2 in Delhi in October 2013. An innovation series putting forward stories from Nepal  Bangladesh and India was launched at a media event in Delhi following HLM2. A dozen stories were produced in regional media  all related to innovative approaches used by Unicef and partners to save children lives. The signing of a regional GWA in Mumbai at the end of November will generate visibility on issues related
297R/A0/08/003/012.indicator_name: Positive articles  interviews highlighting UNICEF's role and/or mandate in the region

A story on children in urban settings was also produced in Kabul. The series on innovations by UNICEF in South Asia allowed ROSA to post stories on www.unicef.org and www.unicefinnovationsinsa.org.

297R/A0/08/003/015.status_value: 'End of Cycle (2012-2013): Following preparatory discussions in 2012  the RMT approved the regional evaluation strategy in mimd-2013.  This was further followed up during the DepReps meeting during which it was agreed that country offices would look at ways in which commitments would be taken forward. Most country offices have responded formally to a request to clarify implications and timeframes.
297R/A0/08/003/015.indicator_name: The RMT approves a Regional Evaluation Strategy and action plan for South Asia

297R/A0/08/003/015.status_value: 'End of Cycle (2012-2013): To date  five out of eight country offices have shared their action plans  thereby meeting the target.  Follow-up with the remaining three country offices is on-going.

297R/A0/08/003/015.status_value: 'End of Cycle (2012-2013):  Five out of the six evaluations submitted during 2012 received satisfactory ratings in GEROS.  The evaluations conducted during 2013 adhered  by and large  to agreed quality standards and procedures and - it is expected - will receive satisfactory ratings within the given target.

In 2013  the Regional office specifically supported Bhutan and Maldives. 297R/A0/09/002/024.status_value: Progress constrained. The KM strategy and operational plan which is about to be finalised will allow to strengthen the documentation of interventions at country level in 2016 and 2017
297R/A0/09/002/024.indicator_name: # of supported COs that have developed and documented adolescent-led innovation initiatives
297R/A0/09/002/024.headline: Intensive coordination and collaboration within ROSA and with all country offices in the region contributed in strengthening the work around adolescent development and participation. Significant progress has been achieved in collecting and analysis data and evidence to assess the situation of adolescents in South Asia for improved actions.

297R/A0/09/002/001.status_value: Following ROSA Gender review- All 8 COs provided with gender specific recomendations to the Reps and Gender Specialists to integrate gender and demonstrate results. Reviewed 3 COs who have an existing gender work plan.  In Aug-Sept 2017  a framework will be developed for all 8 COs for a specific work plan that includes results tracking and accountability levels.
297R/A0/09/002/001.indicator_name: # of COs supported to implement or strengthen monitoring systems for the Gender Action Plan that demonstrate results and take timely corrective actions
297R/A0/09/002/001.headline: Good progress made with visibility and focus on Gender programming  improved communication with countries gender teams  strengthened gender technical guidance in new and existing country programs  stronger quality assurance across sectors  SitAns  Country Programme Document (CPD)  Reviews  Country Office Annual Reports and enhanced rigor in reporting of gender specific results.

297R/A0/09/002/001.status_value: All requested support have been provided in a timely manner to all country offices. In addition 80% of the action points for support from RO that was requested during the Q1 Network Meeting is already completed and shared with all country offices. The Country Offices have not expressed dissatisfaction with the quality of support received on Gender.
297R/A0/09/002/001.indicator_name: % of COs respondents satisfied with the quality of support received from ROSA on gender and rights
297R/A0/09/002/001.headline: Good progress made with visibility and focus on Gender programming  improved communication with countries gender teams  strengthened gender technical guidance in new and existing country programs  stronger quality assurance across sectors  SitAns  Country Programme Document (CPD)  Reviews  Country Office Annual Reports and enhanced rigor in reporting of gender specific results.

297R/A0/09/002/001.status_value: Gender specific activities were advocated for and are identified with each section and the Gender Adviser in the 2017 annual work plans of sections Education  Health/MNCH  C4D  Child protection  ADAP  WASH  Planning and Social Policy. Implementation plans are in good progress. This is 95% of all programme areas at ROSA. Convergent programming from sectors must improve for cross sectoral implementation.
297R/A0/09/002/001.indicator_name: % of gender and rights-related activities identified in each ROSA annual work plan (2014-2017) implemented successfully
297R/A0/09/002/001.headline: Good progress made with visibility and focus on Gender programming  improved communication with countries gender teams  strengthened gender technical guidance in new and existing country programs  stronger quality assurance across sectors  SitAns  Country Programme Document (CPD)  Reviews  Country Office Annual Reports and enhanced rigor in reporting of gender specific results.

297R/A0/09/002/001.status_value: All 4 CPD countries India  Sri Lanka  Nepal and Pakistan had timely  inputs across all sectors Programme Strategy Notes/CPMP on Gender integration. In addition Gender Programmatic Review direct technical support was provided to Nepal CO.  Afghanistan CO was provided with gender inputs across all sectors for MTR  Bhutan CO CPD planning in Aug 2017 includes gender programmatic reviews and inputs.
297R/A0/09/002/001.indicator_name: # of Key Country Programme Documents (CPD  CPAP  MTR and Emergency Preparedness and Response Key Actions) timely and adequately inputted by ROSA Gender Team and Rights Focal Point
297R/A0/09/002/001.headline: Good progress made with visibility and focus on Gender programming  improved communication with countries gender teams  strengthened gender technical guidance in new and existing country programs  stronger quality assurance across sectors  SitAns  Country Programme Document (CPD)  Reviews  Country Office Annual Reports and enhanced rigor in reporting of gender specific results.

297R/A0/09/002/001.status_value: A capacity measurement tool on gender staffs capacity does not exist and yet to be developed within UNICEF. Within South Asia 4 countries (Afghanistan  Bangladesh  India and Pakistan) have fulltime gender specialists with varying levels of gender expertise  skills and functions   Remaining 4 countries  (Bhutan  Nepal  Maldives and Sri Lanka) have focal persons with limited levels of gender technical expertise and skills.  A 2017 ROSA capacity assessment across all COs noted specific skills to be
297R/A0/09/002/001.indicator_name: % of Country Offices that meet recommended standards on gender expertise
297R/A0/09/002/001.headline: Good progress made with visibility and focus on Gender programming  improved communication with countries gender teams  strengthened gender technical guidance in new and existing country programs  stronger quality assurance across sectors  SitAns  Country Programme Document (CPD)  Reviews  Country Office Annual Reports and enhanced rigor in reporting of gender specific results.

297R/A0/09/002/022.indicator_name: Percentage of women 20-24 who were married or in a union by age 18
297R/A0/09/002/022.headline: Programming to end child marriage progressing actively in 5 countries. Evidence generated and shared to reinforce programme design with latest research. UNFPA and UNICEF partnering with common theory of change and joint actions harnessing political will  offering practical solutions to end the practice  including working with SAIEVAC and the SACG.

297R/A0/09/002/022.indicator_name: Countries with 10% reduction in proportion of women 20-24 years married by age 18 years  in countries with prevalence of at least 25%
297R/A0/09/002/022.headline: Programming to end child marriage progressing actively in 5 countries. Evidence generated and shared to reinforce programme design with latest research. UNFPA and UNICEF partnering with common theory of change and joint actions harnessing political will  offering practical solutions to end the practice  including working with SAIEVAC and the SACG.
297R/A0/09/002/022.baseline_value: 5: Afghanistan (40%)  Bangladesh (65%)  Bhutan (26%)  Nepal (41%)  and India (47%). No data is available for Pakistan (Not available)
